title: Our Organic Farming Practices - No Pesticides!

tasks.task: Discussing organic farming practices for CBD.
subtasks: Mentioning the commitment to not using pesticides.
Mentioning the use of natural insect control methods.
Discussing the introduction of carnivorous insects like ladybugs and praying mantises.
Mentioning the commitment to being certified organic.
Acknowledging the commitment to quality for the customers.

tasks.task: Importing natural predators (like ladybugs and praying mantises) into a hemp field for pest control.

Alternatively, another MAINTASK could be "Maintaining an organic certification" but that's more paperwork and compliance. The transcript mentions commitment to organic practices but doesn't describe the day-to-day tasks involved.
Employing biological pest control using predatory insects.
Distributing natural insect predators in an organic hemp field.
Distributing natural insect predators (ladybugs and praying mantises) in an organic hemp field.
MAINTASK: Distributing natural insect predators (ladybugs and praying mantises) in an organic hemp field.
subtasks: Receive ladybugs and praying mantises from the supplier.
Transport ladybugs and praying mantises to the field.
Open containers or bags to release the insects.
Disperse the insects evenly across the field.
Monitor the distribution process to ensure coverage.
Check for any remaining inconsistencies or issues during distribution.
